name: White Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'Italian bread'}, {'quantity': '2/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raw cashews'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'English cucumbers'}, {'quantity': '1 1/2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'green grapes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'cloves garlic'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'sherry vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2 1/2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra virgin olive oil, plus more for drizzling'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Chives, thinly sliced green grapes, and/or thinly sliced cucumbers'}
steps: Let bread, cashews, and water stand in a high-powered blender 5 minutes.. Add chopped cucumbers, grapes, garlic, vinegar, and salt to blender; purée until mostly smooth, about 1 minute. With motor running, drizzle in olive oil; purée until smooth, about 30 seconds more. Chill, covered, about 1 hour. Serve soup drizzled with additional olive oil and garnished with chives, sliced grapes, and/or sliced cucumbers.

name: Chef John's Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'fresh tomatoes, peeled and diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'English cucumber, peeled and finely diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely diced red bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'minced green onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'jalapeño pepper, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'dried oregano'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pint', 'name': 'cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lime, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'thinly sliced fresh basil'}

name: Easy Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'tomato juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried tarragon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried basil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}
steps: Combine tomato juice, tomatoes, onion, bell pepper, cucumber, green onions, parsley, lemon juice, red wine vinegar, garlic, tarragon, basil, sugar, salt, and pepper in a blender or food processor. Blend until well combined but still slightly chunky.. Pour into a serving bowl and cover. Place in the refrigerator to chill before serving, at least 2 hours.

name: Quick Classic Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(14.5 ounce) cans', 'name': "diced tomatoes (I use Hunt's Petite Diced)"}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'seedless cucumber, cut into 1/4-inch dice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'yellow bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1/4-inch dice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, cut into 1/4-inch dice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'garlic cloves, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'sherry vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley, basil or cilantro'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Pour 1/2 cup diced tomatoes into a food processor. Add water and oil to the food processor; blend until puréed. Pour into a medium bowl and add remaining diced tomatoes.. Stir in cucumber, bell pepper, onion, jalapeño, garlic, vinegar, and parsley; season with salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

name: Golden State Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'ripe yellow peaches, peeled and cubed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sliced peeled English cucumber'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped yellow onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped orange bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pints', 'name': 'Sungold cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red cherry tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'kosher salt, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'white wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lime, juiced, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold water, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'crumbled feta cheese, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced peach, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'fresh basil, thinly sliced, or more to taste'}
steps: Combine peaches, cucumber, onion, garlic, bell pepper, and tomatoes in a blender. Season with salt, cumin, and cayenne. Pour in vinegar, lime juice, olive oil, and water. Blend until smooth, starting with a few pulses and finishing on high speed.. Strain soup through a fine-mesh strainer into a large bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until completely chilled, at least 3 to 4 hours.. Stir soup and season to taste. Pour into serving cups and garnish with feta, diced peach, basil, and a sprinkle of cayenne.

name: What Is Gazpacho? Get 7 Tips for Making Great Gazpacho
Mango Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '1/4-inch-diced fresh mangoes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'seedless cucumber, cut into 1/4-inch dice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red bell pepper, seeded and cut into 1/4-inch dice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, cut into 1/4-inch dice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'medium garlic cloves, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley, basil or cilantro'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Salt and freshly ground black pepper'}
steps: Process mangoes, orange juice and oil in a blender or food processor until pureed. Transfer to a medium bowl, along with remaining ingredients. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate until ready to serve. (Can be made several hours before serving.)

name: Shrimp Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '64', 'unit': 'fluid ounces', 'name': 'tomato and clam juice cocktail'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'cooked shrimp, peeled and deveined'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocados, peeled and chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumbers, cubed'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'cilantro, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'pepper'}
steps: Combine tomato and clam juice cocktail, shrimp, avocados, cucumbers, tomatoes, onion, cilantro, lemon juice, salt, and pepper in a large bowl.. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

name: Green Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'diced honeydew melon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'English (seedless) cucumber, peeled and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'avocado'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'jalape'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Blend honeydew melon, cucumber, onion, avocado, jalapeño pepper, garlic, white balsamic vinegar, lime juice, salt, and black pepper in a blender until smooth. Adjust seasonings if desired and chill before serving.

name: Spanish Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'tomatoes, peeled and halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber, peeled and sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, sliced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cold water, or as needed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber, chopped'}
steps: Combine tomatoes, cucumber, bell pepper, onion, vinegar, garlic, and salt in the bowl of a food processor; pulse until blended. Pour olive oil in slowly, with the processor running, until gazpacho is smooth. Add small amounts of cold water as needed to achieve desired consistency.. Serve gazpacho chilled with chopped onion, bell pepper, and cucumber sprinkled over each serving.

name: Cucumber Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'English cucumbers'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped honeydew melon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cubed crustless day-old white bread'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil, plus extra for drizzling'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'sherry vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2 ¼', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'kosher salt, plus more to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'crumbled feta cheese'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh mint'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'honey'}
steps: Thinly slice enough cucumber to measure 1/3 cup; coarsely chop the rest. Transfer cucumber slices to a small bowl; cover and chill until ready to use.. Transfer the chopped cucumber to a blender. Add honeydew, bread cubes, 1/4 cup oil, vinegar, and 2 1/4 teaspoons kosher salt. Process on low speed, gradually increasing speed to high, until cucumber mixture is very smooth and creamy, about 90 seconds.. Pour gazpacho into a medium bowl. Cover and chill until cold, about 1 hour.. Right before serving, toss reserved cucumber slices with feta cheese, mint, honey, and a pinch of salt in a small bowl.. Stir gazpacho, then ladle into four shallow bowls. Top evenly with cucumber-feta mixture and drizzle with olive oil.

name: Chef John's White Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'leeks, white and light-green parts only, thinly sliced crosswise'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'English cucumbers - peeled, quartered and chopped'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': None, 'name': 'green grapes, more for garnish'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'crème fraîche'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'slivered blanched almonds, more for garnish'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'French bread cubes'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'sherry vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cold water, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt, plus more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper, or to taste'}
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Add leeks and cook until soft, 10 to 15 minutes. Transfer to a plate and let cool.. Place cooled leeks, remaining 1 tablespoon oil, cucumbers, grapes, crème fraîche, almonds, bread cubes, vinegar, and water in a blender. Purée until smooth, about 1 minute. Strain through a fine mesh sieve. Cover and chill for 1 to 2 hours.. Taste and season with salt and cayenne pepper. If needed, add more vinegar. Serve garnished with dill oil (see note), thinly sliced grapes, slivered almonds, and fresh dill.

name: Avocado Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'tomato-vegetable juice cocktail (such as V8®)'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'vegetable broth'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomatoes, diced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'avocados - peeled, pitted, and cut into bite-sized pieces'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced cucumber'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'chopped tomatoes with juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped red bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lemon, juiced, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'white wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®), or to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Mix tomato-vegetable juice, vegetable broth, tomatoes, avocados, cucumber, canned tomatoes with juice, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, olive oil, green onions, lemon juice, cilantro, vinegar, hot pepper sauce, salt, and black pepper together in a large bowl. Cover and chill for at least 3 hours before serving to allow flavors to blend.

name: Light and Fresh Mexican Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'celery, diced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell peppers, diced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow bell peppers, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumbers, chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'avocados - peeled, pitted, and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh cilantro, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'green onions, diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(46 fluid ounce) bottle', 'name': 'tomato-vegetable juice cocktail (such as V8®)'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(32 ounce) bottles', 'name': 'tomato and clam juice cocktail'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bottle', 'name': 'hot pepper sauce (such as Cholula®)'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'garlic powder'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Combine celery, red and yellow bell peppers, cucumbers, avocados, cilantro, green onions, red onion, tomato-vegetable juice cocktail, tomato and claim juice cocktail, hot pepper sauce, red wine vinegar, lemon juice, garlic, and garlic powder in a large nonreactive bowl. Season with salt and black pepper. Refrigerate at least 6 hours to blend flavors.

name: Watermelon Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': '¼-inch-diced watermelon, divided'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh orange juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'seedless cucumber, cut into ¼-inch dice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'yellow bell pepper, seeded and cut into ¼-inch dice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'onion, cut into ¼-inch dice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'garlic cloves, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'jalapeño pepper, seeded and minced (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley, basil, or cilantro'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 's'}
steps: Place 1/2 cup of watermelon, orange juice, and oil in a blender or food processor; blend until smooth.. Transfer to a medium bowl; add cucumber, bell pepper, onion, garlic, jalapeño, lime juice, and herbs. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

name: How to Make Gazpacho: Step-by-Step Instructions
Julia's Watermelon Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cubed seeded watermelon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'English (hothouse style) cucumbers, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell peppers, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'jalapeno pepper, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh mint'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pineapple juice'}, {'quantity': '20', 'unit': '', 'name': 'small mint leaves'}
steps: Reserve 20 small pieces of watermelon for garnish. Working in batches, place the remaining watermelon, the cucumbers, red bell peppers, onion, jalapeno pepper, lemon juice, olive oil, 3 tablespoons of fresh mint, the ginger, honey, and pineapple juice into a blender, and blend for about 30 seconds per batch. The mixture should be well blended but retain some texture. Pour into a large pitcher or bowl, and refrigerate 1 hour. Serve in bowls, and garnish each bowl with a couple of chunks of the retained watermelon and 2 small mint leaves.

name: Best Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'ripe tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'cucumber'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'red onion, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'red wine vinegar, or more to tate'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Prepare a bowl with ice water.. Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Cut crosses into the bottom of the tomatoes with a sharp knife, and blanch tomatoes in the boiling water for 1 to 2 minutes until the skin begins to come off. Remove tomatoes with a slotted spoon and immediately immerse in the ice water.. Remove skin from the tomatoes and cut out the seeds over a bowl (so that no juice is lost); discard the seeds.. If the cucumber is organic, leave the peel on; otherwise peel it. Remove seeds of cucumber and roughly chop.. Combine tomatoes, cucumber, onion, garlic, and red wine vinegar in a food processor or blender; blend until gazpacho has desired consistency, either coarsely chopped or finely pureed. Slowly add olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Puree again briefly.. Refrigerate gazpacho until cold, at least 1 hour. Remove from the fridge at least 30 minutes before serving.

name: Cold Tomato Cucumber Soup
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'yellow onion, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'tomatoes, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coconut milk'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'heavy cream'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'grated lime zest'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'maharaja curry powder'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}
steps: Heat olive oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Add onion and saute for 3 minutes. Add tomatoes and continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until tomatoes begin to give up their juices, about 2 minutes. Remove the pan from heat and let cool slightly, 5 to 10 minutes.. Puree tomato mixture in an electric blender by pulsing several times. Add cucumber and pulse until chopped into small pieces. Add coconut milk, mayonnaise, heavy cream, lime zest, curry powder, and salt; pulse until well combined.. Pour soup into a container or bowl and chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour. Serve in bowls garnished with mint leaves and pepper.

name: Dill Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'ripe tomatoes, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumbers, peeled and finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'lemon, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh dill'}
steps: In a large bowl, stir together tomatoes, cucumber, onion, bell pepper, and jalapeno pepper. Season with lemon juice, balsamic vinegar, olive oil, salt and pepper.. In a blender or food processor, puree half of the mixture until smooth. Return to bowl, stir in dill and mix well. Cover and chill for at least one hour before serving.

name: Chilled Zucchini Soup
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh tomato, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh mint, divided'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'zucchini, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'cornstarch'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'cold water'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'lemon juice, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh basil'}
steps: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat and cook onion until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.. Pour water into the saucepan and bring to a boil. Add 4 sprigs of mint and zucchini. Reduce heat to low and simmer soup, covered, for 15 minutes. Remove mint.. Stir together cornstarch and cold water and add to the soup. Increase heat to medium and whisk cornstarch mixture so soup thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and set aside to cool.. Chill soup in the refrigerator until cold, about 2 hours. Before serving, add lemon juice and garnish with remaining mint, basil, and remaining olive oil.

name: Nancy's Boiled Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'tomato juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'beef bouillon cubes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tomato, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped cucumber'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped celery'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®) (Optional)'}
steps: Bring the tomato juice to a simmer over medium-high heat. Stir in the beef bouillon cubes until dissolved, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add the tomato, cucumber, bell pepper, onion, celery, red wine vinegar, vegetable oil, Worcestershire sauce, and hot pepper sauce. Cover and chill for 6 to 8 hours before serving.

name: Gazpacho IV
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'tomatoes, seeded and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tomato juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'beef broth'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped celery'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped cucumber'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'balsamic vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried basil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dried parsley'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'hot pepper sauce'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}
steps: In a large bowl, mix the tomatoes, tomato juice, beef broth, green bell pepper, celery, cucumber, onion, garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, and balsamic vinegar. Season with basil, parsley, salt, pepper, cumin, hot pepper sauce, and Worcestershire sauce. Cover bowl, and refrigerate gazpacho 8 hours or overnight before serving.

name: Mexican Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'poblano pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber - peeled, seeded, and diced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'onion, finely diced'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'fresh ripe tomatoes - stemmed, peeled, and seeded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'jalapeno pepper, stemmed and chopped'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, smashed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lime, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cumin'}
steps: Rub the poblano pepper with olive oil. Roast over the gas flame of your stove, turning often, until the skin is black, 7 to 10 minutes. Place pepper into a paper bag and seal; set aside to cool, about 10 minutes.. Combine cucumber and onion in a bowl. Set aside.. Take cooled poblano from the bag and scrape off the burned skin. Remove stem and seeds; roughly chop the pepper.. Place tomatoes, poblano, jalapeno, garlic, lime juice, sugar, salt, pepper, and cumin into the bowl of a food processor and pulse until thick and not runny. Add cucumber and onion; pulse 3 to 4 times to incorporate. Refrigerate until chilled, about 30 minutes. Serve.

name: Fresh Watermelon Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'diced seeded watermelon, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber - peeled, seeded, and diced, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'jalapeno pepper, minced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'red wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh blueberries'}
steps: Put 6 cups watermelon, 1/2 of the cucumber, jalapeno pepper, and vinegar in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour gazpacho into a large bowl and stir remaining watermelon and cucumber into soup. Refrigerate until chilled, at least 30 minutes.. Divide gazpacho among 4 bowls and top each with blueberries.

name: Cold Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'ripe beefsteak tomatoes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'cucumber, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'yellow bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'sweet onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'extra-virgin olive oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'sherry vinegar'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}
steps: Set aside a few pieces of tomato, cucumber, and bell peppers for garnish.. Combine remaining tomatoes, cucumber, and bell peppers with onion, jalapeno, and garlic in a food processor; process until all vegetable are finely chopped. Mix in olive oil, sherry vinegar, and salt.. Cover and refrigerate until chilled, at least 1 hour.. Season with pepper before serving and garnish with reserved tomatoes, cucumbers, and bell peppers.

name: Summer Watermelon Gazpacho
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cubed seeded watermelon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'roma (plum) tomatoes, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'English (seedless) cucumber - peeled, seeded, and cubed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced shallot'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'salt, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'crumbled feta cheese'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced fresh cilantro'}
steps: Combine watermelon, tomatoes, red pepper, cucumber, shallot, lime juice, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a high-powered blender. Blend until smooth, 20 to 30 seconds. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour to allow flavors to meld and soup to chill.. Stir gazpacho before serving, as it has a tendency to separate, and divide between 4 bowls. Top with feta cheese and cilantro.

name: Bloody Mary Burrata
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'vine-ripened tomatoes'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sliced celery'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'jalapeno, sliced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lemon, juiced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'Worcestershire sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'hot prepared horseradish'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'hot sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'Burrata cheese'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'drizzles', 'name': 'olive oil'}
steps: Combine tomatoes, celery, jalapeno, and garlic in a blender. Pour in water and blend until very smooth. Pass mixture through a fine-mesh strainer and discard skins.. Add lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, horseradish, hot sauce, salt, and pepper. Whisk thoroughly; taste and adjust seasonings. Cover Bloody Mary base with plastic wrap and refrigerate until completely chilled, at least 2 hours.. Ladle 1 cup cold Bloody Mary base into each serving bowl. Dollop 2 ounces Burrata cheese into the center. Season with black pepper and drizzle in olive oil.

name: Gazpacho a la Mrs. Landesman
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, crushed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomatoes, peeled and quartered'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'distilled white vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh parsley, chopped'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'paprika'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 fluid ounce) can', 'name': 'tomato sauce'}
steps: In the container of a food processor or blender, combine the garlic, onion, cucumber, bell pepper, tomatoes, olive oil, vinegar, parsley, salt and pepper. Cover and blend to your desired texture. Stir in the tomato sauce and paprika and transfer to a bowl or container. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour to blend the flavors.

name: Summer's Freshest Mashup: Tomato Soup + Salad
5 Healthy Ways to Eat -- And Drink -- More Watermelon
Watermelon Tomato Gazpacho with a Cool Cucumber Swirl
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'coarsely chopped seedless watermelon'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely diced seedless watermelon'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'Roma tomatoes, halved and seeded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'red bell pepper, roughly chopped'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, sliced, white parts and tops separated'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'lime zest'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh mint'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'crushed red pepper, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'cucumber, peeled and seeded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh parsley'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable broth'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sour cream'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground black pepper'}
steps: For watermelon gazpacho, in a blender or food processor add coarsely chopped watermelon, 2 tomatoes, the bell pepper, the whites of green onions, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, 1 teaspoon lime zest, the lime juice, mint, honey, and crushed red pepper. Cover and blend or process until nearly smooth. Transfer to a large bowl. Chill, covered, 2 to 4 hours. Rinse blender or food processor.. For cucumber soup, finely chop 1/4 of the cucumber and coarsely chop remaining portion. Add coarsely chopped cucumber, garlic, parsley, green onion tops, and remaining lemon juice to blender or food processor. Cover and blend or process until nearly smooth. Transfer to large bowl. Stir in broth, sour cream, salt, and pepper. Chill, covered, 2 to 4 hours.. For tomato topper, chop remaining tomato into 1/2-inch pieces and add to small bowl. Stir in reserved finely chopped watermelon, finely chopped cucumber, and remaining lime zest. Chill, covered, until ready to serve.. To serve, ladle about 1 cup watermelon gazpacho into each bowl. Top each serving with about 1/2 cup cucumber soup and swirl slightly. Top with tomato topper and , if you like, additional black pepper and mint.

name: Cucumber Gazpacho with Mint Paste
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'cucumbers, peeled and halved lengthwise'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '(16 ounce) container', 'name': 'sour cream'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'cayenne pepper'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped hazelnuts'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'lemon juice, or more to taste'}
steps: Scrape cucumber seeds into a fine mesh sieve and press out as much liquid as possible. Reserve liquid and roughly chop cucumbers.. Combine cucumbers and cucumber liquid in the bowl of a food processor; process until smooth.. Whisk cucumber puree and sour cream together in a bowl. Season with sugar and cayenne. Cover and refrigerate.. Mash together mint, olive oil, and hazelnuts in a mortar and pestle until a paste forms. Season with salt and lemon juice.. Divide gazpacho between individual bowls and place a spoonful of mint paste on top of each.
